column4: yeah I tried kxdocker.......hacked it up added some theme stuff then used it for a week and then went back tot the default taskbar
dont laught thats the projects name
yeah damn small  is as about as basic as you can go with Linux
lol I often find laptop thrown out as garbage..... got a nice PII in the garbage one day .....got of the bus and there it was sitting there on top of an old broken chair
yep ones mans trash becomes my Linux ASM chip burner
Ive loaded a few thousand asic chips now with firmware with the free laptop
the thing eve had a built in 8x CDROm working fine......it had a broken windows 98 install on it
Ive noticed you can pick up an IBM Thinkpad laptop cheap ie T21 T22 or even a T42 cheap and they work perfectly with ubuntu.....buddy of mine got a T21 for $120
i'm on the lookout for deals like that
ebay is full of them......corps are dumping them
Me and my nephew need to get notebooks. I've an old clunky gateway I can't stand.
T22 and T42 are very thing laptops and both have more than enough grunt for ubuntu
buildt like sherman tanks...but are thin
